creator: joshwilkins2013
title: A Ttiny Swarm
description: The project is aimed at developing a set of miniature, programmable, and rechargeable robots with interchangeable functionalities using shields. The base designs are line following and obstacle avoidance, which can be overridden by attaching a shield, such as a Bluetooth shield, to control the robot remotely.
steps: Design and build an initial line-following robot prototype, identify its drawbacks like external programming, lack of charging capabilities, and reproducibility issues.
Design the first version of the PCB incorporating an on-board USB programming port, a larger battery, 3D printed motor mounts, and an SPDT power switch.
Identify and fix issues in the initial PCB design, like non-functional components, incorrect power switching electronics, an oversized SPDT switch, and insufficient motor power.
Verify programming and charging components/circuitry, and add the line following components to the PCB design.
Incorporate shields to allow the robot to be controlled via Bluetooth, avoid obstacles, or be charged by solar energy.

Explore future possibilities such as using electropermanent magnets for robot communication and cooperation, reducing the design size with a smaller battery, and increasing functionality with a larger microcontroller like the ATtiny84.
